metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5648 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
While investigating bug 60718, it was noticed that some calls toapplication listeners in Apache Tomcat 9.0.0.M1 to 9.0.0.M17, 8.5.0 to8.5.11, 8.0.0.RC1 to 8.0.41, and 7.0.0 to 7.0.75 did not use theappropriate facade object. When running an untrusted application under aSecurityManager, it was therefore possible for that untrusted applicationto retain a reference to the request or response object and thereby accessand/or modify information associated with another web application.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5648` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libservlet3.0-java - 7.0.75-1
No subscription required

libservlet3.1-java - 8.5.21-1ubuntu1
libtomcat8-embed-java - 8.5.21-1ubuntu1
libtomcat8-java - 8.5.21-1ubuntu1
tomcat8 - 8.5.21-1ubuntu1
tomcat8-admin - 8.5.21-1ubuntu1
tomcat8-common - 8.5.21-1ubuntu1
tomcat8-examples - 8.5.21-1ubuntu1
tomcat8-user - 8.5.21-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tomcat7 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7.0.75-1').
tomcat8 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '8.5.21-1ubuntu1').
